00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the hardware Scheduling unit.
00044  *
00045  * New, starting with SDK 1.7.0, cvmx-pow supports a number of
00046  * extended consistency checks. The define
00047  * CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS controls the runtime insertion of POW
00048  * internal state checks to find common programming errors. If
00049  * CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS is not defined, checks are by default
00050  * enabled. For example, cvmx-pow will check for the following
00051  * program errors or POW state inconsistency.
00052  * - Requesting a POW operation with an active tag switch in
00053  *   progress.
00054  * - Waiting for a tag switch to complete for an excessively
00055  *   long period. This is normally a sign of an error in locking
00056  *   causing deadlock.
00057  * - Illegal tag switches from NULL_NULL.
00058  * - Illegal tag switches from NULL.
00059  * - Illegal deschedule request.
00060  * - WQE pointer not matching the one attached to the core by
00061  *   the POW.
00062  */
00063 #ifndef __CVMX_POW_H__
00064 #define __CVMX_POW_H__
00065 
00066 #include "cvmx-scratch.h"
00067 #include "cvmx-wqe.h"
00068 
00069 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00070 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-sso-defs.h>
00071 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-address.h>
00072 #else
00073 #include "cvmx-warn.h"
00074 #include "cvmx-address.h"
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00078 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00079 extern "C" {
00080 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 /* Default to having all POW constancy checks turned on */
00084 #ifndef CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS
00085 #define CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS 1
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 /*
00089  * Special type for CN78XX style SSO groups (0..255),
00090  * for distinction from legacy-style groups (0..15)
00091  */
00092 typedef union {
00093     uint8_t xgrp;
00094     /* Fields that map XGRP for backwards compatibility */
00095     struct __attribute__ ((__packed__)) {
00096 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00097         uint8_t group : 5;
00098         uint8_t qus   : 3;
00099 #else
00100         uint8_t qus   : 3;
00101         uint8_t group : 5;
00102 #endif
00103     };
00104 } cvmx_xgrp_t;
00105 
00106 /*
00107  * Softwsare-only structure to convey a return value
00108  * containing multiple information fields about an work queue entry
00109  */
00110 typedef struct {
00111     uint32_t tag;
00112     uint16_t index;
00113     uint8_t grp; /* Legacy group # (0..15) */
00114     uint8_t tag_type;
00115 } cvmx_pow_tag_info_t;
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * Wait flag values for pow functions.
00119  */
00120 typedef enum {
00121     CVMX_POW_WAIT = 1,
00122     CVMX_POW_NO_WAIT = 0,
00123 } cvmx_pow_wait_t;
00124 
00125 /**
00126  *  POW tag operations.  These are used in the data stored to the POW.
00127  */
00128 typedef enum {
00129     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG = 0L,
00130         /**< Switch the tag (only) for this PP
00131          - the previous tag should be non-NULL in this case
00132          - tag switch response required
00133          - fields used: op, type, tag */
00134     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL = 1L,
00135         /**< Switch the tag for this PP, with full information
00136          - this should be used when the previous tag is NULL
00137          - tag switch response required
00138          - fields used: address, op, grp, type, tag */
00139     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH = 2L,
00140         /**< Switch the tag (and/or group) for this PP and de-schedule
00141          - OK to keep the tag the same and only change the group
00142          - fields used: op, no_sched, grp, type, tag */
00143     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH = 3L,
00144         /**< Just de-schedule
00145          - fields used: op, no_sched */
00146     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ = 4L,
00147         /**< Create an entirely new work queue entry
00148          - fields used: address, op, qos, grp, type, tag */
00149     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP = 5L,
00150         /**< Just update the work queue pointer and grp for this PP
00151          - fields used: address, op, grp */
00152     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SET_NSCHED = 6L,
00153         /**< Set the no_sched bit on the de-schedule list
00154          - does nothing if the selected entry is not on the de-schedule list
00155          - does nothing if the stored work queue pointer does not match the address field
00156          - fields used: address, index, op
00157          Before issuing a *_NSCHED operation, SW must guarantee that all
00158          prior deschedules and set/clr NSCHED operations are complete and all
00159          prior switches are complete. The hardware provides the opsdone bit
00160          and swdone bit for SW polling. After issuing a *_NSCHED operation,
00161          SW must guarantee that the set/clr NSCHED is complete before
00162          any subsequent operations. */
00163     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_CLR_NSCHED = 7L,
00164         /**< Clears the no_sched bit on the de-schedule list
00165          - does nothing if the selected entry is not on the de-schedule list
00166          - does nothing if the stored work queue pointer does not match the address field
00167          - fields used: address, index, op
00168          Before issuing a *_NSCHED operation, SW must guarantee that all
00169          prior deschedules and set/clr NSCHED operations are complete and all
00170          prior switches are complete. The hardware provides the opsdone bit
00171          and swdone bit for SW polling. After issuing a *_NSCHED operation,
00172          SW must guarantee that the set/clr NSCHED is complete before
00173          any subsequent operations. */
00174     CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_NOP = 15L
00175         /**< Do nothing */
00176 } cvmx_pow_tag_op_t;
00177 
00178 /**
00179  * This structure defines the store data on a store to POW
00180  */
00181 typedef union {
00182     uint64_t u64;
00183     struct {
00184 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00185         uint64_t no_sched :1;
00186             /**< Don't reschedule this entry.
00187              no_sched is used for CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH and CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH */
00188         uint64_t unused :2;
00189         uint64_t index :13;
00190             /**< Contains index of entry for a CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_*_NSCHED */
00191         cvmx_pow_tag_op_t op :4;
00192             /**< The operation to perform */
00193         uint64_t unused2 :2;
00194         uint64_t qos :3;
00195             /**< The QOS level for the packet. qos is only used for CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ */
00196         uint64_t grp :4;
00197             /**< The group that the work queue entry will be scheduled to grp is used for
00198              CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ, CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL, CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH,
00199              and CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP */
00200         cvmx_pow_tag_type_t type :3;
00201             /**< The type of the tag. type is used for everything except
00202              CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH, CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP, and
00203              CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_*_NSCHED */
00204         uint64_t tag :32;
00205             /**< The actual tag. tag is used for everything except
00206              CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH, CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP, and
00207             CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_*_NSCHED */
00208 #else
00209         uint64_t tag :32;
00210         cvmx_pow_tag_type_t type :3;
00211         uint64_t grp :4;
00212         uint64_t qos :3;
00213         uint64_t unused2 :2;
00214         cvmx_pow_tag_op_t op :4;
00215         uint64_t index :13;
00216         uint64_t unused :2;
00217         uint64_t no_sched :1;
00218 #endif
00219     } s_cn38xx;
00220     struct {
00221 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00222         uint64_t no_sched :1;
00223             /**< Don't reschedule this entry.
00224              no_sched is used for CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH and CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH */
00225         cvmx_pow_tag_op_t op :4;
00226             /**< The operation to perform */
00227         uint64_t unused1 :4;
00228         uint64_t index :11;
00229             /**< Contains index of entry for a CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_*_NSCHED */
00230         uint64_t unused2 :1;
00231         uint64_t grp :6;
00232             /**< The group that the work queue entry will be scheduled to grp is used
00233              for CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ, CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL,
00234              CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH, and CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP */
00235         uint64_t unused3 :3;
00236         cvmx_pow_tag_type_t type :2;
00237             /**< The type of the tag.
00238              type is used for everything except CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH,
00239              CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP, and CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_*_NSCHED */

00323     struct {
00324 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00325         uint64_t rsvd_62_63 :2;
00326         uint64_t grp :10; /** NODE+LGROUP */
00327             /** Group that the work-queue entry will be scheduled to.
00328              grp is used for ADDWQ, SWTAG_FULL, SWTAG_DESCH, UPD_WQP_GRP. */
00329         cvmx_pow_tag_type_t type :2;
00330             /** The type of the tag */
00331         uint64_t no_sched :1;
00332             /** Don't reschedule this entry. NOSCHED is used for SWTAG_DESCH and DESCHED.*/
00333         uint64_t rsvd_48 :1;
00334         cvmx_pow_tag_op_t op :4;
00335             /** The operation to perform */
00336         uint64_t rsvd_42_43 :2;
00337         uint64_t wqp :42;
00338             /** Address of the work-queue entry. Must be aligned on a 64-bit boundary.
00339              Used for SWTAG_FULL, ADDWQ, UPD_WQP_GRP; addr<2:0> must be zero. */
00340 #else
00341         uint64_t wqp :42;
00342         uint64_t rsvd_42_43 :2;
00343         cvmx_pow_tag_op_t op :4;
00344             /**< The operation to perform */
00345         uint64_t rsvd_48 :1;
00346         uint64_t no_sched :1;
00347         cvmx_pow_tag_type_t type :2;
00348         uint64_t grp :10;
00349         uint64_t rsvd_62_63 :2;
00350 #endif
00351     } s_cn78xx_other;

00355 union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr {
00356     uint64_t u64;
00357     struct {
00358         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00359             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00360         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13,
00361         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1,/**< Must be one */
00362         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00363         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr :40,
00364         ;)))))
00365     } s;
00366     struct {
00367         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00368             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00369         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13,
00370         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00371         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00372         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node :4,
00373             /**<OCI node number. For SWTAG*, and UPD_WQP_GRP this must
00374              always indicate the local node, or an error will result.
00375              ADDWQ can be performed onto any node. */
00376         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t tag :32,
00377             /**< The actual tag. Tag is used for SWTAG, SWTAG_FULL,
00378              SWTAG_DESCHED, ADDWQ. */
00379         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_3 :4,
00380         ;)))))))
00381     } s_cn78xx;
00382 };

00384 /**
00385  * This structure describes the address to load stuff from POW
00386  */
00387 typedef union {
00388     uint64_t u64;
00389     /**
00390      * Address for new work request loads (did<2:0> == 0)
00391      */
00392     struct {
00393         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00394             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00395         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00396         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00397         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00398             /**< The ID of POW -- did<2:0> == 0 in this case */
00399         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_4_39 :36, /**< Must be zero */
00400         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t wait :1,
00401             /**< If set, don't return load response until work is available */
00402         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_2 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00403         )))))));
00404     } swork;
00405 
00406     struct {
00407         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00408             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00409         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00410         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00411         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00412             /**< The ID of POW -- did<2:0> == 0 in this case */
00413         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node :4, /**< OCI Node number */
00414         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_32_35 :4, /**< Must be zero */
00415         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t indexed :1, /**< Indexed get_work if set */
00416         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t grouped :1, /**< get_work for group specified in index */
00417         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rtngrp :1, /**< Return group and tt in the return if set */
00418         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_16_28 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00419         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t index :12, /**< mask/grp/index of the request */
00420         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t wait :1,
00421             /**< If set, don't return load response until work is available */
00422         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_2 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00423         )))))))))))));
00424     } swork_78xx;
00425     /**
00426      * Address for loads to get POW internal status
00427      */
00428     struct {
00429         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00430             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00431         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00432         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00433         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00434             /**< The ID of POW -- did<2:0> == 1 in this case */
00435         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_10_39 :30, /**< Must be zero */
00436         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t coreid :4, /**< The core id to get status for */
00437         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t get_rev :1,
00438             /**< If set and get_cur is set, return reverse tag-list pointer rather
00439              than forward tag-list pointer */
00440         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t get_cur :1,
00441             /**< If set, return current status rather than pending status */

00443             /**< If set, get the work-queue pointer rather than tag/type */

00446     } sstatus;

00464     /**
00465      * Address for memory loads to get POW internal state
00466      */
00467     struct {
00468         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00469             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00470         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00471         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00472         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00473             /**< The ID of POW -- did<2:0> == 2 in this case */
00474         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_16_39 :24, /**< Must be zero */
00475         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t index :11, /**< POW memory index */
00476         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t get_des :1,
00477             /**< If set, return deschedule information rather than the standard
00478              response for work-queue index (invalid if the work-queue entry is
00479              not on the deschedule list). */
00480         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t get_wqp :1,
00481             /**< If set, get the work-queue pointer rather than tag/type
00482              (no effect when get_des set). */
00483         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_2 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00484         )))))))));
00485     } smemload;
00486     /**
00487      * Address for memory loads to get SSO internal state
00488      */
00489     struct {
00490         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00491             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00492         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00493         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00494         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00495             /**< The ID of SSO - did<2:0> == 2 in this case */
00496         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_20_39 :20, /**< Must be zero */
00497         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t index :11, /**< SSO memory index */
00498         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_6_8 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00499         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t opcode :3,
00500             /**< Read TAG/WQ pointer/pending tag/next potr */
00501         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_2 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00502         )))))))));
00503     } smemload_cn68xx;
00504     /**
00505      * Address for index/pointer loads
00506      */
00507     struct {
00508         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00509             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00510         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00511         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00512         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00513             /**< The ID of POW -- did<2:0> == 3 in this case */
00514         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_9_39 :31, /**< Must be zero */
00515         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t qosgrp :4,
00516             /**< When {get_rmt ==0 AND get_des_get_tail == 0}, this field selects one of
00517              eight POW internal-input queues (0-7), one per QOS level; values 8-15 are
00518              illegal in this case.
00519              When {get_rmt ==0 AND get_des_get_tail == 1}, this field selects one of
00520              16 deschedule lists (per group);
00521              When get_rmt ==1, this field selects one of 16 memory-input queue lists.
00522              The two memory-input queue lists associated with each QOS level are:
00523              - qosgrp = 0, qosgrp = 8:      QOS0
00524              - qosgrp = 1, qosgrp = 9:      QOS1
00525              - qosgrp = 2, qosgrp = 10:     QOS2
00526              - qosgrp = 3, qosgrp = 11:     QOS3
00527              - qosgrp = 4, qosgrp = 12:     QOS4
00528              - qosgrp = 5, qosgrp = 13:     QOS5
00529              - qosgrp = 6, qosgrp = 14:     QOS6
00530              - qosgrp = 7, qosgrp = 15:     QOS7 */
00531         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t get_des_get_tail :1,
00532             /**< If set and get_rmt is clear, return deschedule list indexes
00533              rather than indexes for the specified qos level.
00534              If set and get_rmt is set, return the tail pointer rather than the head
00535              pointer for the specified qos level. */
00536         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t get_rmt :1,
00537             /**< If set, return remote pointers rather than the local indexes
00538              for the specified qos level. */
00539         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_2 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00540         )))))))));
00541     } sindexload;
00542     /**
00543      * Address for a Index/Pointer loads to get SSO internal state
00544      */
00545     struct {
00546         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00547             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00548         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00549         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00550         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00551             /**< The ID of SSO - did<2:0> == 2 in this case */
00552         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_15_39 :25, /**< Must be zero */
00553         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t qos_grp :6,
00554             /**< When opcode = IPL_IQ, this field specifies IQ (or QOS).
00555              When opcode = IPL_DESCHED, this field specifies the group.
00556              This field is reserved for all other opcodes. */
00557         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_6_8 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00558         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t opcode :3,
00559             /**< Read TAG/WQ pointer/pending tag/next potr */
00560         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_2 :3, /**< Must be zero */
00561         )))))))));
00562     } sindexload_cn68xx;
00563     /**
00564      * Address for NULL_RD request (did<2:0> == 4)
00565      * when this is read, HW attempts to change the state to NULL if it is NULL_NULL
00566      * (the hardware cannot switch from NULL_NULL to NULL if a POW entry is not available -
00567      * software may need to recover by finishing another piece of work before a POW
00568      * entry can ever become available.)
00569      */
00570     struct {
00571         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mem_region :2,
00572             /**< Mips64 address region. Should be CVMX_IO_SEG */
00573         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_49_61 :13, /**< Must be zero */
00574         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t is_io :1, /**< Must be one */
00575         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did :8,
00576             /**< the ID of POW -- did<2:0> == 4 in this case */
00577         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_0_39 :40, /**< Must be zero */
00578         )))));
00579     } snull_rd;
00580 } cvmx_pow_load_addr_t;
00581 
00582 /**
00583  * This structure defines the response to a load/SENDSINGLE to POW (except CSR reads)
00584  */
00585 typedef union {
00586     uint64_t u64;
00587     /**
00588      * Response to new work request loads
00589      */
00590     struct {
00591         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t no_work :1,
00592             /**< Set when no new work queue entry was returned.
00593              If there was de-scheduled work, the HW will definitely return it.
00594              When this bit is set, it could mean
00595              - There was no work, or
00596              - There was no work that the HW could find. This case can happen
00597              regardless of the wait bit value in the original request, when there
00598              is work in the IQ's that is too deep down the list. */
00599         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t pend_switch :1,
00600             /**< cn68XX and above, set if there was a pending tag switch*/
00601         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t tt :2,
00602         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_58_59 :2,
00603         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t grp :10,
00604         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved_42_47 :6, /**< Must be zero */
00605         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr :42, /**< 36 in O1 -- the work queue pointer */
00606         )))))));
00607     } s_work;

00609     /**
00610      * Result for a POW Status Load (when get_cur==0 and get_wqp==0)
00611      */
00612     struct {
00613 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00614         uint64_t reserved_62_63 :2;
00615         uint64_t pend_switch :1;
00616             /**< Set when there is a pending non-NULL SWTAG or SWTAG_FULL, and
00617              the POW entry has not left the list for the original tag. */
00618         uint64_t pend_switch_full :1;
00619             /**< Set when SWTAG_FULL and pend_switch is set. */
00620         uint64_t pend_switch_null :1;
00621             /**< Set when there is a pending NULL SWTAG, or an implicit switch to NULL. */
00622         uint64_t pend_desched :1;
00623             /**< Set when there is a pending DESCHED or SWTAG_DESCHED. */
00624         uint64_t pend_desched_switch :1;
00625             /**< Set when there is a pending SWTAG_DESCHED and pend_desched is set. */
00626         uint64_t pend_nosched :1;
00627             /**< Set when nosched is desired and pend_desched is set. */
00628         uint64_t pend_new_work :1;
00629             /**< Set when there is a pending GET_WORK. */
00630         uint64_t pend_new_work_wait :1;
00631             /**< When pend_new_work is set, this bit indicates that the wait bit was set. */
00632         uint64_t pend_null_rd :1;
00633             /**< Set when there is a pending NULL_RD. */
00634         uint64_t pend_nosched_clr :1;
00635             /**< Set when there is a pending CLR_NSCHED. */

00641         uint64_t reserved_34_35 :2;

00643             /**< This is the tag type when pend_switch or
00644              (pend_desched AND pend_desched_switch) are set. */
00645         uint64_t pend_tag :32;
00646             /**< This is the tag when pend_switch or
00647              (pend_desched AND pend_desched_switch) are set. */
00648 #else

00650         uint64_t pend_type :2;
00651         uint64_t reserved_34_35 :2;
00652         uint64_t pend_grp :4;
00653         uint64_t pend_index :11;
00654         uint64_t reserved_51 :1;
00655         uint64_t pend_nosched_clr :1;
00656         uint64_t pend_null_rd :1;
00657         uint64_t pend_new_work_wait :1;
00658         uint64_t pend_new_work :1;
00659         uint64_t pend_nosched :1;
00660         uint64_t pend_desched_switch :1;
00661         uint64_t pend_desched :1;
00662         uint64_t pend_switch_null :1;
00663         uint64_t pend_switch_full :1;
00664         uint64_t pend_switch :1;
00665         uint64_t reserved_62_63 :2;
00666 #endif
00667     } s_sstatus0;

00941 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD

00944             /**< Points to the prior POW entry in the tag list when head == 0
00945              (and tag_type is not NULL or NULL_NULL). This field is unpredictable
00946              when the core's state is NULL or NULL_NULL. */

00950              Updated when new tag list entered on SWTAG_FULL. */

00952             /**< Set when this POW entry is at the head of its tag list.
00953              Also set when in the NULL or NULL_NULL state. */
00954         uint64_t tail:1;
00955             /**< Set when this POW entry is at the tail of its tag list.
00956              Also set when in the NULL or NULL_NULL state. */
00957         uint64_t tag_type:2;
00958             /**< The tag type attached to the core.
00959              Updated when new tag list entered on SWTAG, SWTAG_FULL, or SWTAG_DESCHED. */
00960         uint64_t tag:32;
00961             /**< The tag attached to the core.
00962              Updated when new tag list entered on SWTAG, SWTAG_FULL, or SWTAG_DESCHED. */
00963 #else

00967         uint64_t head:1;
00968         uint64_t grp:4;

01464         uint64_t free_tail:11;
01465             /**< When free_val is set, indicates the last entry on the free list. */
01466         uint64_t loc_val:1;
01467             /**< Set when there is one or more POW entries on the input Q list
01468              selected by qosgrp. */
01469         uint64_t loc_one:1;
01470             /**< Set when there is exactly one POW entry on the input Q list
01471              selected by qosgrp. */
01472         uint64_t reserved_23:1;
01473         uint64_t loc_head:11;
01474             /**< When loc_val is set, indicates the first entry on the input Q list
01475              selected by qosgrp. */
01476         uint64_t reserved_11:1;
01477         uint64_t loc_tail:11;
01478             /**< When loc_val is set, indicates the last entry on the input Q list
01479              selected by qosgrp. */
01480 #else
01481         uint64_t loc_tail:11;
01482         uint64_t reserved_11:1;
01483         uint64_t loc_head:11;
01484         uint64_t reserved_23:1;
01485         uint64_t loc_one:1;
01486         uint64_t loc_val:1;
01487         uint64_t free_tail:11;
01488         uint64_t reserved_37:1;
01489         uint64_t free_head:11;
01490         uint64_t reserved_49:1;
01491         uint64_t free_one:1;
01492         uint64_t free_val:1;
01493         uint64_t reserved_52_63:12;
01494 #endif
01495     } sindexload0;
01496     /**
01497      * Result for SSO Index/Pointer Load(opcode ==
01498      * IPL_IQ/IPL_DESCHED/IPL_NOSCHED)
01499      */
01500     struct {
01501 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01502         uint64_t reserved_28_63:36;
01503         uint64_t queue_val:1;
01504             /**< - If set, one or more valid entries are in the queue. */
01505         uint64_t queue_one:1;
01506             /**< - If set, exactly one valid entry is in the queue. */
01507         uint64_t reserved_24_25:2;
01508         uint64_t queue_head:11;
01509             /**< - Index of entry at the head of the queue. */
01510         uint64_t reserved_11_12:2;
01511         uint64_t queue_tail:11;
01512             /**< - Index of entry at the tail of the queue. */
01513 #else
01514         uint64_t queue_tail:11;
01515         uint64_t reserved_11_12:2;
01516         uint64_t queue_head:11;
01517         uint64_t reserved_24_25:2;
01518         uint64_t queue_one:1;
01519         uint64_t queue_val:1;
01520         uint64_t reserved_28_63:36;
01521 #endif
01522     } sindexload0_cn68xx;
01523     /**
01524      * Result For POW Index/Pointer Load (get_rmt == 0/get_des_get_tail == 1)
01525      */
01526     struct {
01527 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01528         uint64_t reserved_52_63:12;
01529         uint64_t nosched_val:1;
01530             /**< Set when there is one or more POW entries on the nosched list. */
01531         uint64_t nosched_one:1;
01532             /**< Set when there is exactly one POW entry on the nosched list. */
01533         uint64_t reserved_49:1;
01534         uint64_t nosched_head:11;
01535             /**< When nosched_val is set, indicates the first entry on the nosched list. */
01536         uint64_t reserved_37:1;
01537         uint64_t nosched_tail:11;
01538             /**< When nosched_val is set, indicates the last entry on the nosched list. */
01539         uint64_t des_val:1;
01540             /**< Set when there is one or more descheduled heads on the descheduled
01541              list selected by qosgrp. */
01542         uint64_t des_one:1;
01543             /**< Set when there is exactly one descheduled head on the descheduled
01544              list selected by qosgrp. */
01545         uint64_t reserved_23:1;
01546         uint64_t des_head:11;
01547             /**< When des_val is set, indicates the first descheduled head on
01548              the descheduled list selected by qosgrp. */
01549         uint64_t reserved_11:1;
01550         uint64_t des_tail:11;
01551             /**< When des_val is set, indicates the last descheduled head on
01552              the descheduled list selected by qosgrp. */
01553 #else
01554         uint64_t des_tail:11;
01555         uint64_t reserved_11:1;
01556         uint64_t des_head:11;
01557         uint64_t reserved_23:1;
01558         uint64_t des_one:1;
01559         uint64_t des_val:1;
01560         uint64_t nosched_tail:11;
01561         uint64_t reserved_37:1;
01562         uint64_t nosched_head:11;
01563         uint64_t reserved_49:1;
01564         uint64_t nosched_one:1;
01565         uint64_t nosched_val:1;
01566         uint64_t reserved_52_63:12;
01567 #endif
01568     } sindexload1;
01569     /**
01570      * Result for SSO Index/Pointer Load(opcode == IPL_FREE0/IPL_FREE1/IPL_FREE2)
01571      */
01572     struct {
01573 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01574         uint64_t reserved_60_63:4;
01575         uint64_t qnum_head:2; /**< - Subqueue with current head */
01576         uint64_t qnum_tail:2; /**< - Subqueue with current tail */
01577         uint64_t reserved_28_55:28;
01578         uint64_t queue_val:1;
01579             /**< - If set, one or more valid entries are in the queue. */
01580         uint64_t queue_one:1;
01581             /**< - If set, exactly one valid entry is in the queue. */
01582         uint64_t reserved_24_25:2;
01583         uint64_t queue_head:11;
01584             /**< - Index of entry at the head of the queue. */
01585         uint64_t reserved_11_12:2;
01586         uint64_t queue_tail:11;
01587             /**< - Index of entry at the tail of the queue. */
01588 #else
01589         uint64_t queue_tail:11;
01590         uint64_t reserved_11_12:2;
01591         uint64_t queue_head:11;
01592         uint64_t reserved_24_25:2;
01593         uint64_t queue_one:1;
01594         uint64_t queue_val:1;
01595         uint64_t reserved_28_55:28;
01596         uint64_t qnum_tail:2;
01597         uint64_t qnum_head:2;
01598         uint64_t reserved_60_63:4;
01599 #endif
01600     } sindexload1_cn68xx;
01601     /**
01602      * Result For POW Index/Pointer Load (get_rmt == 1/get_des_get_tail == 0)
01603      */
01604     struct {
01605 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01606         uint64_t reserved_39_63:25;
01607         uint64_t rmt_is_head:1;
01608             /**< Set when this DRAM list is the current head
01609              (i.e. is the next to be reloaded when the POW hardware reloads
01610              a POW entry from DRAM). The POW hardware alternates between the two DRAM
01611              lists associated with a QOS level when it reloads work from DRAM
01612              into the POW unit. */
01613         uint64_t rmt_val:1;
01614             /**< Set when the DRAM portion of the input Q list selected by qosgrp
01615              contains one or more pieces of work. */
01616         uint64_t rmt_one:1;
01617             /**< Set when the DRAM portion of the input Q list selected by qosgrp
01618              contains exactly one piece of work. */
01619         uint64_t rmt_head:36;
01620             /**< When rmt_val is set, indicates the first piece of work on the
01621              DRAM input Q list selected by qosgrp. */
01622 #else
01623         uint64_t rmt_head:36;
01624         uint64_t rmt_one:1;
01625         uint64_t rmt_val:1;
01626         uint64_t rmt_is_head:1;
01627         uint64_t reserved_39_63:25;
01628 #endif
01629     } sindexload2;
01630     /**
01631      * Result For POW Index/Pointer Load (get_rmt == 1/get_des_get_tail == 1)
01632      */
01633     struct {
01634 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01635         uint64_t reserved_39_63:25;
01636         uint64_t rmt_is_head:1;
01637             /**< - Set when this DRAM list is the current head (i.e. is the next to
01638              be reloaded when the POW hardware reloads a POW entry from DRAM).
01639              The POW hardware alternates between the two DRAM lists associated with a QOS
01640              level when it reloads work from DRAM into the POW unit. */
01641         uint64_t rmt_val:1;
01642             /**< - Set when the DRAM portion of the input Q list selected by qosgrp
01643              contains one or more pieces of work. */
01644         uint64_t rmt_one:1;

01646              contains exactly one piece of work. */
01647         uint64_t rmt_tail:36;
01648             /**< - When rmt_val is set, indicates the last piece of work on the DRAM
01649              input Q list selected by qosgrp. */
01650 #else
01651         uint64_t rmt_tail:36;
01652         uint64_t rmt_one:1;
01653         uint64_t rmt_val:1;
01654         uint64_t rmt_is_head:1;

01656 #endif
01657     } sindexload3;
01658     /**
01659      * Response to NULL_RD request loads
01660      */
01661     struct {
01662 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01663         uint64_t unused:62;
01664         uint64_t state:2;
01665             /**< Of type cvmx_pow_tag_type_t. state is one of the following:
01666              - CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ORDERED
01667              - CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC
01668              - CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL
01669              - CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL */
01670 #else
01671         uint64_t state:2;
01672         uint64_t unused:62;
01673 #endif
01674     } s_null_rd;
01675 
01676 } cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t;
01677 
01678 typedef union {
01679     uint64_t u64;
01680     struct {
01681 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01682         uint64_t reserved_57_63:7;
01683         uint64_t index:11;
01684         uint64_t reserved_45:1;
01685         uint64_t grp:6;
01686         uint64_t head:1;
01687         uint64_t tail:1;
01688         uint64_t reserved_34_36:3;
01689         uint64_t tag_type:2;
01690         uint64_t tag:32;
01691 #else
01692         uint64_t tag:32;
01693         uint64_t tag_type:2;
01694         uint64_t reserved_34_36:3;
01695         uint64_t tail:1;
01696         uint64_t head:1;
01697         uint64_t grp:6;
01698         uint64_t reserved_45:1;
01699         uint64_t index:11;
01700         uint64_t reserved_57_63:7;
01701 #endif
01702     } s;
01703 } cvmx_pow_sl_tag_resp_t;
01704 
01705 /**
01706  * This structure describes the address used for stores to the POW.
01707  *  The store address is meaningful on stores to the POW.  The hardware assumes that an aligned
01708  *  64-bit store was used for all these stores.
01709  *  Note the assumption that the work queue entry is aligned on an 8-byte
01710  *  boundary (since the low-order 3 address bits must be zero).
01711  *  Note that not all fields are used by all operations.
01712  *
01713  *  NOTE: The following is the behavior of the pending switch bit at the PP
01714  *       for POW stores (i.e. when did<7:3> == 0xc)
01715  *     - did<2:0> == 0      => pending switch bit is set
01716  *     - did<2:0> == 1      => no affect on the pending switch bit
01717  *     - did<2:0> == 3      => pending switch bit is cleared
01718  *     - did<2:0> == 7      => no affect on the pending switch bit
01719  *     - did<2:0> == others => must not be used
01720  *     - No other loads/stores have an affect on the pending switch bit
01721  *     - The switch bus from POW can clear the pending switch bit
01722  *
01723  *  NOTE: did<2:0> == 2 is used by the HW for a special single-cycle ADDWQ command
01724  *  that only contains the pointer). SW must never use did<2:0> == 2.
01725  */
01726 typedef union {
01727     uint64_t u64;
01728     struct {
01729 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01730         uint64_t mem_reg:2; /**< Memory region.  Should be CVMX_IO_SEG in most cases */
01731         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13; /**< Must be zero */
01732         uint64_t is_io:1; /**< Must be one */
01733         uint64_t did:8; /**< Device ID of POW. Note that different sub-dids are used. */
01734         uint64_t addr:40; /**< Address field. addr<2:0> must be zero */
01735 #else
01736         uint64_t addr:40;
01737         uint64_t did:8;
01738         uint64_t is_io:1;
01739         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13;
01740         uint64_t mem_reg:2;
01741 #endif
01742     } stag;
01743 } cvmx_pow_tag_store_addr_t; /* FIXME- this type is unused */
01744 
01745 /**
01746  * Decode of the store data when an IOBDMA SENDSINGLE is sent to POW
01747  */
01748 typedef union {
01749     uint64_t u64;
01750     struct {
01751         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t scraddr:8,
01752             /**< the (64-bit word) location in scratchpad to write to (if len != 0) */
01753         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t len:8,
01754             /**< the number of words in the response (0 => no response) */
01755         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,
01756             /**< the ID of the device on the non-coherent bus */
01757         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t unused:36,
01758         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t wait:1,
01759             /**< if set, don't return load response until work is available */
01760         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t unused2:3,
01761         ))))));
01762     } s;
01763     struct {
01764         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t scraddr:8,
01765             /**< the (64-bit word) location in scratchpad to write to (if len != 0) */
01766         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t len:8,
01767             /**< the number of words in the response (0 => no response) */
01768         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,
01769             /**< the ID of the device on the non-coherent bus */
01770         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node:4,
01771             /**< OCI node number, should always be local node */
01772         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t unused1:4,
01773         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t indexed:1,
01774         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t grouped:1,
01775         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rtngrp:1,
01776         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t unused2:13,
01777         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t index_grp_mask:12,
01778         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t wait:1,
01779             /**< if set, don't return load response until work is available */
01780         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t unused3:3,
01781         ))))))))))));
01782     } s_cn78xx;
01783 } cvmx_pow_iobdma_store_t;
01784 
01785 /* CSR typedefs have been moved to cvmx-pow-defs.h */
01786 
01787 /*enum for group priority parameters which needs modification*/
01788 enum cvmx_sso_group_modify_mask{
01789     CVMX_SSO_MODIFY_GROUP_PRIORITY = 0x01,
01790     CVMX_SSO_MODIFY_GROUP_WEIGHT = 0x02,
01791     CVMX_SSO_MODIFY_GROUP_AFFINITY = 0x04
01792 };
01793 
01794 /**
01795  * @INTERNAL
01796  * Return the number of SSO groups for a given SoC model
01797  */
01798 static inline unsigned cvmx_sso_num_xgrp(void)
01799 {
01800     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
01801         return 256;
01802     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
01803         return 64;
01804     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX))
01805         return 64;
01806     cvmx_printf("ERROR: %s: Unknown model\n", __func__);
01807     return 0;
01808 }
01809 
01810 /**
01811  * @INTERNAL
01812  * Return the number of POW groups on current model.
01813  * In case of CN78XX/CN73XX this is the number of equivalent
01814  * "legacy groups" on the chip when it is used in backward
01815  * compatible mode.
01816  */
01817 static inline unsigned cvmx_pow_num_groups(void)
01818 {
01819     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))
01820         return cvmx_sso_num_xgrp() >> 3;
01821     else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE))
01822         return 64;
01823     else
01824         return 16;
01825 }
01826 
01827 /**
01828  * @INTERNAL
01829  * Return the number of mask-set registers.
01830  */
01831 static inline unsigned cvmx_sso_num_maskset(void)
01832 {
01833     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))
01834         return 2;
01835     else
01836         return 1;
01837 }
01838 
01839 /**
01840  * Get the POW tag for this core. This returns the current
01841  * tag type, tag, group, and POW entry index associated with
01842  * this core. Index is only valid if the tag type isn't NULL_NULL.
01843  * If a tag switch is pending this routine returns the tag before
01844  * the tag switch, not after.
01845  *
01846  * @return Current tag
01847  */
01848 static inline cvmx_pow_tag_info_t cvmx_pow_get_current_tag(void)
01849 {
01850     cvmx_pow_load_addr_t load_addr;
01851     cvmx_pow_tag_info_t result;
01852 
01853     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
01854         cvmx_sso_sl_ppx_tag_t sl_ppx_tag;
01855         cvmx_xgrp_t xgrp;
01856         int node, core;
01857 
01858         CVMX_SYNCS;
01859         node = cvmx_get_node_num();
01860         core = cvmx_get_local_core_num();
01861         sl_ppx_tag.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_SSO_SL_PPX_TAG(core));
01862         result.index = sl_ppx_tag.s.index;
01863         result.tag_type = sl_ppx_tag.s.tt;
01864         result.tag      = sl_ppx_tag.s.tag;
01865 
01866         /* Get native XGRP value */
01867         xgrp.xgrp =  sl_ppx_tag.s.grp;
01868 
01869         /* Return legacy style group 0..15 */
01870         result.grp = xgrp.group;
01871     } else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
01872         cvmx_pow_sl_tag_resp_t load_resp;
01873         load_addr.u64 = 0;
01874         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
01875         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.is_io = 1;
01876         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG5;
01877         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.coreid = cvmx_get_core_num();
01878         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.opcode = 3;
01879         load_resp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(load_addr.u64);
01880         result.grp = load_resp.s.grp;
01881         result.index = load_resp.s.index;
01882         result.tag_type = load_resp.s.tag_type;
01883         result.tag = load_resp.s.tag;
01884     } else {
01885         cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t load_resp;
01886         load_addr.u64 = 0;
01887         load_addr.sstatus.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
01888         load_addr.sstatus.is_io = 1;
01889         load_addr.sstatus.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
01890         load_addr.sstatus.coreid = cvmx_get_core_num();
01891         load_addr.sstatus.get_cur = 1;
01892         load_resp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(load_addr.u64);
01893         result.grp = load_resp.s_sstatus2.grp;
01894         result.index = load_resp.s_sstatus2.index;
01895         result.tag_type = load_resp.s_sstatus2.tag_type;
01896         result.tag = load_resp.s_sstatus2.tag;
01897     }
01898     return result;
01899 }
01900 
01901 /**
01902  * Get the POW WQE for this core. This returns the work queue
01903  * entry currently associated with this core.
01904  *
01905  * @return WQE pointer
01906  */
01907 static inline cvmx_wqe_t *cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp(void)
01908 {
01909     cvmx_pow_load_addr_t load_addr;
01910     cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t load_resp;
01911 
01912     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
01913         cvmx_sso_sl_ppx_wqp_t sso_wqp;
01914         int node = cvmx_get_node_num();
01915         int core = cvmx_get_local_core_num();
01916         sso_wqp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_SSO_SL_PPX_WQP(core));
01917         if (sso_wqp.s.wqp)
01918             return (cvmx_wqe_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(sso_wqp.s.wqp);
01919         return (cvmx_wqe_t *) 0;
01920     }
01921     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
01922         load_addr.u64 = 0;
01923         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
01924         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.is_io = 1;
01925         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG5;
01926         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.coreid = cvmx_get_core_num();
01927         load_addr.sstatus_cn68xx.opcode = 4;
01928         load_resp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(load_addr.u64);
01929         if (load_resp.s_sstatus3_cn68xx.wqp)
01930             return (cvmx_wqe_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(load_resp.s_sstatus3_cn68xx.wqp);
01931         else
01932             return (cvmx_wqe_t *) 0;
01933     } else {
01934         load_addr.u64 = 0;
01935         load_addr.sstatus.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
01936         load_addr.sstatus.is_io = 1;
01937         load_addr.sstatus.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
01938         load_addr.sstatus.coreid = cvmx_get_core_num();
01939         load_addr.sstatus.get_cur = 1;
01940         load_addr.sstatus.get_wqp = 1;
01941         load_resp.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(load_addr.u64);
01942         return (cvmx_wqe_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(load_resp.s_sstatus4.wqp);
01943     }
01944 }
01945 
01946 /**
01947  * @INTERNAL
01948  * Print a warning if a tag switch is pending for this core
01949  *
01950  * @param function Function name checking for a pending tag switch
01951  */
01952 static inline void __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(const char *function)
01953 {
01954     uint64_t switch_complete;
01955     CVMX_MF_CHORD(switch_complete);
01956     cvmx_warn_if(!switch_complete, "%s called with tag switch in progress\n", function);
01957 }
01958 
01959 /**
01960  * Waits for a tag switch to complete by polling the completion bit.
01961  * Note that switches to NULL complete immediately and do not need
01962  * to be waited for.
01963  */
01964 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait(void)
01965 {
01966     const uint64_t MAX_CYCLES = 1ull << 31;
01967     uint64_t switch_complete;
01968     uint64_t start_cycle;
01969 
01970     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS)
01971         start_cycle = cvmx_get_cycle();
01972 
01973     while (1) {
01974         CVMX_MF_CHORD(switch_complete);
01975         if (cvmx_likely(switch_complete))
01976             break;
01977         if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
01978             if (cvmx_unlikely(cvmx_get_cycle() > (start_cycle + MAX_CYCLES))) {
01979                 cvmx_dprintf("WARNING: %s: Tag switch is taking a long time, "
01980                     "possible deadlock\n", __func__);
01981                 start_cycle += MAX_CYCLES - 1;
01982             }
01983         }
01984     }
01985 }
01986 
01987 /**
01988  * Synchronous work request.  Requests work from the POW.
01989  * This function does NOT wait for previous tag switches to complete,
01990  * so the caller must ensure that there is not a pending tag switch.
01991  *
01992  * @param wait   When set, call stalls until work becomes avaiable, or times out.
01993  *               If not set, returns immediately.
01994  *
01995  * @return Returns the WQE pointer from POW. Returns NULL if no work was available.
01996  */
01997 static inline cvmx_wqe_t *cvmx_pow_work_request_sync_nocheck(cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
01998 {
01999     cvmx_pow_load_addr_t ptr;
02000     cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t result;
02001 
02002     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS)
02003         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02004 
02005     ptr.u64 = 0;
02006     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02007         ptr.swork_78xx.node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02008         ptr.swork_78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02009         ptr.swork_78xx.is_io = 1;
02010         ptr.swork_78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02011         ptr.swork_78xx.wait = wait;
02012     } else {
02013         ptr.swork.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02014         ptr.swork.is_io = 1;
02015         ptr.swork.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02016         ptr.swork.wait = wait;
02017     }
02018     result.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(ptr.u64);
02019     if (result.s_work.no_work)
02020         return NULL;
02021     else
02022         return (cvmx_wqe_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(result.s_work.addr);
02023 }
02024 
02025 /**
02026  * Synchronous work request.  Requests work from the POW.
02027  * This function waits for any previous tag switch to complete before
02028  * requesting the new work.
02029  *
02030  * @param wait   When set, call stalls until work becomes avaiable, or times out.
02031  *               If not set, returns immediately.
02032  *
02033  * @return Returns the WQE pointer from POW. Returns NULL if no work was available.
02034  */
02035 static inline cvmx_wqe_t *cvmx_pow_work_request_sync(cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
02036 {
02037     /* Must not have a switch pending when requesting work */
02038     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02039     return (cvmx_pow_work_request_sync_nocheck(wait));
02040 }
02041 
02042 /**
02043  * Synchronous null_rd request.  Requests a switch out of NULL_NULL POW state.
02044  * This function waits for any previous tag switch to complete before
02045  * requesting the null_rd.
02046  *
02047  * @return Returns the POW state of type cvmx_pow_tag_type_t.
02048  */
02049 static inline cvmx_pow_tag_type_t cvmx_pow_work_request_null_rd(void)
02050 {
02051     cvmx_pow_load_addr_t ptr;
02052     cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t result;
02053 
02054     /* Must not have a switch pending when requesting work */
02055     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02056 
02057     ptr.u64 = 0;
02058     ptr.snull_rd.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02059     ptr.snull_rd.is_io = 1;
02060     ptr.snull_rd.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_NULL_RD;
02061 
02062     result.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(ptr.u64);
02063     return (cvmx_pow_tag_type_t)result.s_null_rd.state;
02064 }
02065 
02066 /**
02067  * Asynchronous work request.
02068  * Work is requested from the POW unit, and should later be checked with
02069  * function cvmx_pow_work_response_async.
02070  * This function does NOT wait for previous tag switches to complete,
02071  * so the caller must ensure that there is not a pending tag switch.
02072  *
02073  * @param scr_addr Scratch memory address that response will be returned to,
02074  *     which is either a valid WQE, or a response with the invalid bit set.
02075  *     Byte address, must be 8 byte aligned.
02076  * @param wait 1 to cause response to wait for work to become available (or timeout)
02077  *             0 to cause response to return immediately
02078  */
02079 static inline void cvmx_pow_work_request_async_nocheck(int scr_addr,
02080     cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
02081 {
02082     cvmx_pow_iobdma_store_t data;
02083 
02084     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS)
02085         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02086 
02087     /* scr_addr must be 8 byte aligned */
02088     data.u64 = 0;
02089     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02090         data.s_cn78xx.node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02091         data.s_cn78xx.scraddr = scr_addr >> 3;
02092         data.s_cn78xx.len = 1;
02093         data.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02094         data.s_cn78xx.wait = wait;
02095     } else {
02096         data.s.scraddr = scr_addr >> 3;
02097         data.s.len = 1;
02098         data.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02099         data.s.wait = wait;
02100     }
02101     cvmx_send_single(data.u64);
02102 }
02103 
02104 /**
02105  * Asynchronous work request.
02106  * Work is requested from the POW unit, and should later be checked with
02107  * function cvmx_pow_work_response_async.
02108  * This function waits for any previous tag switch to complete before
02109  * requesting the new work.
02110  *
02111  * @param scr_addr Scratch memory address that response will be returned to,
02112  *     which is either a valid WQE, or a response with the invalid bit set.
02113  *     Byte address, must be 8 byte aligned.
02114  * @param wait 1 to cause response to wait for work to become available (or timeout)
02115  *             0 to cause response to return immediately
02116  */
02117 static inline void cvmx_pow_work_request_async(int scr_addr, cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
02118 {
02119     /* Must not have a switch pending when requesting work */
02120     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02121     cvmx_pow_work_request_async_nocheck(scr_addr, wait);
02122 }
02123 
02124 /**
02125  * Gets result of asynchronous work request.  Performs a IOBDMA sync
02126  * to wait for the response.
02127  *
02128  * @param scr_addr Scratch memory address to get result from
02129  *                  Byte address, must be 8 byte aligned.
02130  * @return Returns the WQE from the scratch register, or NULL if no work was available.
02131  */
02132 static inline cvmx_wqe_t *cvmx_pow_work_response_async(int scr_addr)
02133 {
02134     cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t result;
02135 
02136     CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
02137     result.u64 = cvmx_scratch_read64(scr_addr);
02138     if (result.s_work.no_work)
02139         return NULL;
02140     else
02141         return (cvmx_wqe_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(result.s_work.addr);
02142 }
02143 
02144 /**
02145  * Checks if a work queue entry pointer returned by a work
02146  * request is valid.  It may be invalid due to no work
02147  * being available or due to a timeout.
02148  *
02149  * @param wqe_ptr pointer to a work queue entry returned by the POW
02150  *
02151  * @return 0 if pointer is valid
02152  *         1 if invalid (no work was returned)
02153  */
02154 static inline uint64_t cvmx_pow_work_invalid(cvmx_wqe_t * wqe_ptr)
02155 {
02156     return (wqe_ptr == NULL); /* FIXME: improve */
02157 }
02158 
02159 /**
02160  * Starts a tag switch to the provided tag value and tag type.  Completion for
02161  * the tag switch must be checked for separately.
02162  * This function does NOT update the
02163  * work queue entry in dram to match tag value and type, so the application must
02164  * keep track of these if they are important to the application.
02165  * This tag switch command must not be used for switches to NULL, as the tag
02166  * switch pending bit will be set by the switch request, but never cleared by the
02167  * hardware.
02168  *
02169  * NOTE: This should not be used when switching from a NULL tag.  Use
02170  * cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full() instead.
02171  *
02172  * This function does no checks, so the caller must ensure that any previous tag
02173  * switch has completed.
02174  *
02175  * @param tag      new tag value
02176  * @param tag_type new tag type (ordered or atomic)
02177  */
02178 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_nocheck(uint32_t tag, cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type)
02179 {
02180     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
02181     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
02182 
02183     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
02184         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
02185         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02186         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
02187         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
02188             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
02189         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
02190             "%s called with NULL tag\n", __func__);
02191         cvmx_warn_if((current_tag.tag_type == tag_type) && (current_tag.tag == tag),
02192             "%s called to perform a tag switch to the same tag\n", __func__);
02193         cvmx_warn_if(tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
02194             "%s called to perform a tag switch to NULL. "
02195             "Use cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null() instead\n", __func__);
02196     }
02197     /* Note that WQE in DRAM is not updated here, as the POW does not read from DRAM
02198      * once the WQE is in flight.  See hardware manual for complete details.
02199      * It is the application's responsibility to keep track of the current tag
02200      * value if that is important.
02201      */
02202     tag_req.u64 = 0;
02203     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02204         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op   = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
02205         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
02206     } else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02207         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
02208         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.tag = tag;
02209         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.type = tag_type;
02210     } else {
02211         tag_req.s_cn38xx.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
02212         tag_req.s_cn38xx.tag = tag;
02213         tag_req.s_cn38xx.type = tag_type;
02214     }
02215     ptr.u64 = 0;
02216     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02217         ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02218         ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
02219         ptr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02220         ptr.s_cn78xx.node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02221         ptr.s_cn78xx.tag  = tag;
02222     } else {
02223         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02224         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02225         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02226     }
02227     /* Once this store arrives at POW, it will attempt the switch
02228        software must wait for the switch to complete separately */
02229     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
02230 }
02231 
02232 /**
02233  * Starts a tag switch to the provided tag value and tag type.  Completion for
02234  * the tag switch must be checked for separately.
02235  * This function does NOT update the
02236  * work queue entry in dram to match tag value and type, so the application must
02237  * keep track of these if they are important to the application.
02238  * This tag switch command must not be used for switches to NULL, as the tag
02239  * switch pending bit will be set by the switch request, but never cleared by the
02240  * hardware.
02241  *
02242  * NOTE: This should not be used when switching from a NULL tag.  Use
02243  * cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full() instead.
02244  *
02245  * This function waits for any previous tag switch to complete, and also
02246  * displays an error on tag switches to NULL.
02247  *
02248  * @param tag      new tag value
02249  * @param tag_type new tag type (ordered or atomic)
02250  */
02251 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw(uint32_t tag, cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type)
02252 {
02253     /* Note that WQE in DRAM is not updated here, as the POW does not read from DRAM
02254      * once the WQE is in flight.  See hardware manual for complete details.
02255      * It is the application's responsibility to keep track of the current tag
02256      * value if that is important.
02257      */
02258     /* Ensure that there is not a pending tag switch, as a tag switch cannot be started
02259      ** if a previous switch is still pending.  */
02260     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02261     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_nocheck(tag, tag_type);
02262 }
02263 
02264 /**
02265  * Starts a tag switch to the provided tag value and tag type.  Completion for
02266  * the tag switch must be checked for separately.
02267  * This function does NOT update the
02268  * work queue entry in dram to match tag value and type, so the application must
02269  * keep track of these if they are important to the application.
02270  * This tag switch command must not be used for switches to NULL, as the tag
02271  * switch pending bit will be set by the switch request, but never cleared by the
02272  * hardware.
02273  *
02274  * This function must be used for tag switches from NULL.
02275  *
02276  * This function does no checks, so the caller must ensure that any previous tag
02277  * switch has completed.
02278  *
02279  * @param wqp      pointer to work queue entry to submit.  This entry is updated to match the other parameters
02280  * @param tag      tag value to be assigned to work queue entry
02281  * @param tag_type type of tag
02282  * @param group      group value for the work queue entry.
02283  */
02284 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full_nocheck(cvmx_wqe_t * wqp, uint32_t tag,
02285     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint64_t group)
02286 {
02287     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
02288     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
02289     unsigned node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02290     uint64_t wqp_phys = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
02291 
02292     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
02293         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
02294         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02295         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
02296         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
02297             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
02298         cvmx_warn_if((current_tag.tag_type == tag_type) && (current_tag.tag == tag),
02299             "%s called to perform a tag switch to the same tag\n", __func__);
02300         cvmx_warn_if(tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
02301             "%s called to perform a tag switch to NULL. "
02302             "Use cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null() instead\n", __func__);
02303         if ((wqp != cvmx_phys_to_ptr(0x80)) && cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp())
02304             cvmx_warn_if(wqp != cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp(),
02305                 "%s passed WQE(%p) doesn't match the address in the POW(%p)\n",
02306                 __func__, wqp, cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp());
02307     }
02308     /* Note that WQE in DRAM is not updated here, as the POW does not read from DRAM
02309      * once the WQE is in flight.  See hardware manual for complete details.
02310      * It is the application's responsibility to keep track of the current tag
02311      * value if that is important.
02312      */
02313     tag_req.u64 = 0;
02314     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02315         unsigned xgrp;
02316 
02317         if(wqp_phys!= 0x80) {
02318             /* If WQE is valid, use its XGRP:
02319              * WQE GRP is 10 bits, and is mapped
02320              * to legacy GRP + QoS, includes node number.
02321              */
02322             xgrp = wqp->word1.cn78xx.grp;
02323             /* Use XGRP[node] too */
02324             node = xgrp >> 8;
02325             /* Modify XGRP with legacy group # from arg */
02326             xgrp &= ~0xf8;
02327             xgrp |= 0xf8 & (group << 3);
02328 
02329         } else {
02330             /* If no WQE, build XGRP with QoS=0 and current node */
02331             xgrp = group << 3;
02332             xgrp |= node << 8;
02333         }
02334         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL;
02335         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
02336         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.grp = xgrp;
02337         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.wqp = wqp_phys;
02338     }
02339     else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02340         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL;
02341         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.tag = tag;
02342         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.type = tag_type;
02343         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.grp = group;
02344     } else {
02345         tag_req.s_cn38xx.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL;
02346         tag_req.s_cn38xx.tag = tag;
02347         tag_req.s_cn38xx.type = tag_type;
02348         tag_req.s_cn38xx.grp = group;
02349     }
02350     ptr.u64 = 0;
02351     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02352         ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02353         ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
02354         ptr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02355         ptr.s_cn78xx.node = node;
02356         ptr.s_cn78xx.tag  = tag;
02357     } else {
02358         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02359         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02360         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
02361         ptr.s.addr = wqp_phys;
02362     }
02363     /* Once this store arrives at POW, it will attempt the switch
02364        software must wait for the switch to complete separately */
02365     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
02366 }
02367 
02368 /**
02369  * Starts a tag switch to the provided tag value and tag type.
02370  * Completion for the tag switch must be checked for separately.
02371  * This function does NOT update the work queue entry in dram to match tag value
02372  * and type, so the application must keep track of these if they are important
02373  * to the application. This tag switch command must not be used for switches
02374  * to NULL, as the tag switch pending bit will be set by the switch request,
02375  * but never cleared by the hardware.
02376  *
02377  * This function must be used for tag switches from NULL.
02378  *
02379  * This function waits for any pending tag switches to complete
02380  * before requesting the tag switch.
02381  *
02382  * @param wqp      Pointer to work queue entry to submit.
02383  *     This entry is updated to match the other parameters
02384  * @param tag      Tag value to be assigned to work queue entry
02385  * @param tag_type Type of tag
02386  * @param group    Group value for the work queue entry.
02387  */
02388 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full(cvmx_wqe_t * wqp, uint32_t tag,
02389     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint64_t group)
02390 {
02391     /* Ensure that there is not a pending tag switch, as a tag switch cannot
02392      * be started if a previous switch is still pending. */
02393     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02394     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full_nocheck(wqp, tag, tag_type, group);
02395 }
02396 
02397 /**
02398  * Switch to a NULL tag, which ends any ordering or
02399  * synchronization provided by the POW for the current
02400  * work queue entry.  This operation completes immediately,
02401  * so completion should not be waited for.
02402  * This function does NOT wait for previous tag switches to complete,
02403  * so the caller must ensure that any previous tag switches have completed.
02404  */
02405 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null_nocheck(void)
02406 {
02407     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
02408     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
02409 
02410     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
02411         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
02412         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02413         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
02414         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
02415             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
02416         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
02417             "%s called when we already have a NULL tag\n", __func__);
02418     }
02419     tag_req.u64 = 0;
02420     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02421         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
02422         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL;
02423     }
02424     else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02425         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
02426         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.type = CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL;
02427     } else {
02428         tag_req.s_cn38xx.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
02429         tag_req.s_cn38xx.type = CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL;
02430     }
02431     ptr.u64 = 0;
02432     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02433         ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02434         ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
02435         ptr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
02436         ptr.s_cn78xx.node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02437     } else {
02438         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02439         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02440         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
02441     }
02442     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
02443 }
02444 
02445 /**
02446  * Switch to a NULL tag, which ends any ordering or
02447  * synchronization provided by the POW for the current
02448  * work queue entry.  This operation completes immediatly,
02449  * so completion should not be waited for.
02450  * This function waits for any pending tag switches to complete
02451  * before requesting the switch to NULL.
02452  */
02453 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null(void)
02454 {
02455     /* Ensure that there is not a pending tag switch, as a tag switch cannot
02456      * be started if a previous switch is still pending. */
02457     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02458     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null_nocheck();
02459 }
02460 
02461 /**
02462  * Submits work to an input queue.
02463  * This function updates the work queue entry in DRAM to match the arguments given.
02464  * Note that the tag provided is for the work queue entry submitted, and
02465  * is unrelated to the tag that the core currently holds.
02466  *
02467  * @param wqp      pointer to work queue entry to submit.
02468  *                 This entry is updated to match the other parameters
02469  * @param tag      tag value to be assigned to work queue entry
02470  * @param tag_type type of tag
02471  * @param qos      Input queue to add to.
02472  * @param grp      group value for the work queue entry.
02473  */
02474 static inline void cvmx_pow_work_submit(cvmx_wqe_t * wqp, uint32_t tag,
02475     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint64_t qos, uint64_t grp)
02476 {
02477     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
02478     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
02479 
02480     tag_req.u64 = 0;
02481     ptr.u64 = 0;
02482 
02483     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02484         unsigned node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02485         unsigned xgrp;
02486 
02487         xgrp = (grp & 0x1f) << 3 ;
02488         xgrp |= (qos & 7);
02489         xgrp |= 0x300 & (node << 8);
02490 
02491         wqp->word1.cn78xx.rsvd_0 = 0;
02492         wqp->word1.cn78xx.rsvd_1 = 0;
02493         wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag = tag;
02494         wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag_type = tag_type;
02495         wqp->word1.cn78xx.grp = xgrp;
02496         CVMX_SYNCWS;
02497 
02498         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ;
02499         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
02500         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.wqp = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
02501         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.grp = xgrp;
02502 
02503         ptr.s_cn78xx.did = 0x66; //CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG6;
02504         ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02505         ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
02506         ptr.s_cn78xx.node = node;
02507         ptr.s_cn78xx.tag = tag;
02508     } else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02509         /* Reset all reserved bits */
02510         wqp->word1.cn68xx.zero_0 = 0;
02511         wqp->word1.cn68xx.zero_1 = 0;
02512         wqp->word1.cn68xx.zero_2 = 0;
02513         wqp->word1.cn68xx.qos = qos;
02514         wqp->word1.cn68xx.grp = grp;
02515 
02516         wqp->word1.tag = tag;
02517         wqp->word1.tag_type = tag_type;
02518 
02519         tag_req.s_cn68xx_add.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ;
02520         tag_req.s_cn68xx_add.type = tag_type;
02521         tag_req.s_cn68xx_add.tag = tag;
02522         tag_req.s_cn68xx_add.qos = qos;
02523         tag_req.s_cn68xx_add.grp = grp;
02524 
02525         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02526         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02527         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
02528         ptr.s.addr = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
02529     } else {
02530         /* Reset all reserved bits */
02531         wqp->word1.cn38xx.zero_2 = 0;
02532         wqp->word1.cn38xx.qos = qos;
02533         wqp->word1.cn38xx.grp = grp;
02534 
02535         wqp->word1.tag = tag;
02536         wqp->word1.tag_type = tag_type;
02537 
02538         tag_req.s_cn38xx.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ;
02539         tag_req.s_cn38xx.type = tag_type;
02540         tag_req.s_cn38xx.tag = tag;
02541         tag_req.s_cn38xx.qos = qos;
02542         tag_req.s_cn38xx.grp = grp;
02543 
02544         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02545         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02546         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
02547         ptr.s.addr = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
02548     }
02549     /* SYNC write to memory before the work submit.
02550      * This is necessary as POW may read values from DRAM at this time */
02551     CVMX_SYNCWS;
02552     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
02553 }
02554 
02555 /**
02556  * This function sets the group mask for a core.  The group mask
02557  * indicates which groups each core will accept work from. There are
02558  * 16 groups.
02559  *
02560  * @param core_num   core to apply mask to
02561  * @param mask   Group mask, one bit for up to 64 groups.
02562  *               Each 1 bit in the mask enables the core to accept work from
02563  *               the corresponding group.
02564  *               The CN68XX supports 64 groups, earlier models only support
02565  *               16 groups.
02566  *
02567  * The CN78XX in backwards compatibility mode allows up to 32 groups,
02568  * so the 'mask' argument has one bit for every of the legacy
02569  * groups, and a '1' in the mask causes a total of 8 groups
02570  * which share the legacy group numbher and 8 qos levels,
02571  * to be enabled for the calling processor core.
02572  * A '0' in the mask will disable the current core
02573  * from receiving work from the associated group.
02574  */
02575 static inline void cvmx_pow_set_group_mask(uint64_t core_num, uint64_t mask)
02576 {
02577     uint64_t valid_mask;
02578     int num_groups = cvmx_pow_num_groups();
02579 
02580     if (num_groups >= 64)
02581         valid_mask = ~0ull;
02582     else
02583         valid_mask = (1ull << num_groups)-1;
02584 
02585     if ((mask & valid_mask) == 0) {
02586         cvmx_printf("ERROR: "
02587         "%s empty group mask disables work on core# %llu, ignored.\n",
02588         __func__, (unsigned long long) core_num);
02589         return;
02590     }
02591     cvmx_warn_if(mask & (~valid_mask),
02592         "%s group number range exceeded: %#llx\n",
02593         __func__, (unsigned long long) mask);
02594 
02595     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02596         unsigned mask_set;
02597         cvmx_sso_ppx_sx_grpmskx_t grp_msk;
02598         unsigned core, node;
02599         unsigned rix;   /* Register index */
02600         unsigned grp;   /* Legacy group # */
02601         unsigned bit;   /* bit index */
02602         unsigned xgrp;  /* native group # */
02603 
02604         node = cvmx_coremask_core_to_node(core_num);
02605         core = cvmx_coremask_core_on_node(core_num);
02606 
02607         /* 78xx: 256 groups divided into 4 X 64 bit registers */
02608         /* 73xx: 64 groups are in one register */
02609         for (rix = 0; rix < (cvmx_sso_num_xgrp() >> 6); rix ++ ) {
02610             grp_msk.u64 = 0;
02611             for(bit = 0; bit < 64; bit++) {
02612                 /* 8-bit native XGRP number */
02613                 xgrp = (rix << 6) | bit;
02614                 /* Legacy 5-bit group number */
02615                 grp = (xgrp >> 3) & 0x1f;
02616                 /* Inspect legacy mask by legacy group */
02617                 if(mask & (1ull << grp))
02618                     grp_msk.s.grp_msk |= 1ull << bit;
02619                 /* Pre-set to all 0's */
02620             }
02621             for (mask_set = 0;
02622                 mask_set < cvmx_sso_num_maskset();
02623                 mask_set ++)
02624                 cvmx_write_csr_node(node,
02625                 CVMX_SSO_PPX_SX_GRPMSKX(core, mask_set, rix),
02626                 grp_msk.u64);
02627         }
02628     } else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02629         cvmx_sso_ppx_grp_msk_t grp_msk;
02630         grp_msk.s.grp_msk = mask;
02631         cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_SSO_PPX_GRP_MSK(core_num), grp_msk.u64);
02632     } else {
02633         cvmx_pow_pp_grp_mskx_t grp_msk;
02634 
02635         grp_msk.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_POW_PP_GRP_MSKX(core_num));
02636         grp_msk.s.grp_msk = mask & 0xffff;
02637         cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_POW_PP_GRP_MSKX(core_num), grp_msk.u64);
02638     }
02639 }
02640 
02641 /**
02642  * This function sets POW static priorities for a core. Each input queue has
02643  * an associated priority value.
02644  *
02645  * @param core_num   core to apply priorities to
02646  * @param priority   Vector of 8 priorities, one per POW Input Queue (0-7).
02647  *                   Highest priority is 0 and lowest is 7. A priority value
02648  *                   of 0xF instructs POW to skip the Input Queue when
02649  *                   scheduling to this specific core.
02650  *                   NOTE: priorities should not have gaps in values, meaning
02651  *                         {0,1,1,1,1,1,1,1} is a valid configuration while
02652  *                         {0,2,2,2,2,2,2,2} is not.
02653  */
02654 static inline void cvmx_pow_set_priority(uint64_t core_num, const uint8_t priority[])
02655 {
02656     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN3XXX))
02657         return;
02658 
02659     /* Detect gaps between priorities and flag error */
02660     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02661         int i;
02662         uint32_t prio_mask = 0;
02663 
02664         for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
02665             if (priority[i] != 0xF)
02666                 prio_mask |= 1 << priority[i];
02667 
02668         if (prio_mask ^ ((1 << cvmx_pop(prio_mask)) - 1)) {
02669             cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: POW static priorities should be contiguous (0x%llx)\n",
02670                 (unsigned long long)prio_mask);
02671             return;
02672         }
02673     }
02674 
02675     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02676         unsigned group;
02677         unsigned node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02678         cvmx_sso_grpx_pri_t grp_pri;
02679 
02680         grp_pri.s.weight = 0x3f;
02681         grp_pri.s.affinity = 0xf;
02682 
02683         for(group = 0; group < cvmx_sso_num_xgrp(); group ++ ) {
02684             grp_pri.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node,
02685                 CVMX_SSO_GRPX_PRI(group));
02686             grp_pri.s.pri = priority[group & 0x7];
02687             cvmx_write_csr_node(node,
02688                 CVMX_SSO_GRPX_PRI(group), grp_pri.u64);
02689         }
02690 
02691     } else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02692         cvmx_sso_ppx_qos_pri_t qos_pri;
02693 
02694         qos_pri.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_SSO_PPX_QOS_PRI(core_num));
02695         qos_pri.s.qos0_pri = priority[0];
02696         qos_pri.s.qos1_pri = priority[1];
