02697         qos_pri.s.qos2_pri = priority[2];
02698         qos_pri.s.qos3_pri = priority[3];
02699         qos_pri.s.qos4_pri = priority[4];
02700         qos_pri.s.qos5_pri = priority[5];
02701         qos_pri.s.qos6_pri = priority[6];
02702         qos_pri.s.qos7_pri = priority[7];
02703         cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_SSO_PPX_QOS_PRI(core_num), qos_pri.u64);
02704     } else {
02705         /* POW priorities on CN5xxx .. CN66XX */
02706         cvmx_pow_pp_grp_mskx_t grp_msk;
02707 
02708         grp_msk.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_POW_PP_GRP_MSKX(core_num));
02709         grp_msk.s.qos0_pri = priority[0];
02710         grp_msk.s.qos1_pri = priority[1];
02711         grp_msk.s.qos2_pri = priority[2];
02712         grp_msk.s.qos3_pri = priority[3];
02713         grp_msk.s.qos4_pri = priority[4];
02714         grp_msk.s.qos5_pri = priority[5];
02715         grp_msk.s.qos6_pri = priority[6];
02716         grp_msk.s.qos7_pri = priority[7];
02717 
02718         cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_POW_PP_GRP_MSKX(core_num), grp_msk.u64);
02719     }
02720 }
02721 
02722 /**
02723  * Performs a tag switch and then an immediate deschedule. This completes
02724  * immediately, so completion must not be waited for.  This function does NOT
02725  * update the wqe in DRAM to match arguments.
02726  *
02727  * This function does NOT wait for any prior tag switches to complete, so the
02728  * calling code must do this.
02729  *
02730  * Note the following CAVEAT of the Octeon HW behavior when
02731  * re-scheduling DE-SCHEDULEd items whose (next) state is
02732  * ORDERED:
02733  *   - If there are no switches pending at the time that the
02734  *     HW executes the de-schedule, the HW will only re-schedule
02735  *     the head of the FIFO associated with the given tag. This
02736  *     means that in many respects, the HW treats this ORDERED
02737  *     tag as an ATOMIC tag. Note that in the SWTAG_DESCH
02738  *     case (to an ORDERED tag), the HW will do the switch
02739  *     before the deschedule whenever it is possible to do
02740  *     the switch immediately, so it may often look like
02741  *     this case.
02742  *   - If there is a pending switch to ORDERED at the time
02743  *     the HW executes the de-schedule, the HW will perform
02744  *     the switch at the time it re-schedules, and will be
02745  *     able to reschedule any/all of the entries with the
02746  *     same tag.
02747  * Due to this behavior, the RECOMMENDATION to software is
02748  * that they have a (next) state of ATOMIC when they
02749  * DE-SCHEDULE. If an ORDERED tag is what was really desired,
02750  * SW can choose to immediately switch to an ORDERED tag
02751  * after the work (that has an ATOMIC tag) is re-scheduled.
02752  * Note that since there are never any tag switches pending
02753  * when the HW re-schedules, this switch can be IMMEDIATE upon
02754  * the reception of the pointer during the re-schedule.
02755  *
02756  * @param tag      New tag value
02757  * @param tag_type New tag type
02758  * @param group    New group value
02759  * @param no_sched Control whether this work queue entry will be rescheduled.
02760  *                 - 1 : don't schedule this work
02761  *                 - 0 : allow this work to be scheduled.
02762  */
02763 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_desched_nocheck(uint32_t tag,
02764     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint64_t group, uint64_t no_sched)
02765 {
02766     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
02767     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
02768 
02769     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
02770         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
02771         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02772         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
02773         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
02774             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
02775         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
02776             "%s called with NULL tag. Deschedule not allowed from NULL state\n",
02777             __func__);
02778         cvmx_warn_if((current_tag.tag_type != CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC) &&
02779             (tag_type != CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC),
02780             "%s called where neither the before or after tag is ATOMIC\n", __func__);
02781     }
02782     tag_req.u64 = 0;
02783     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02784         cvmx_wqe_t *wqp = cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp();
02785         if (wqp == NULL) {
02786             cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: Failed to get WQE, %s\n", __func__);
02787             return;
02788         }
02789         group &= 0x1f;
02790         wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag = tag;
02791         wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag_type = tag_type;
02792         wqp->word1.cn78xx.grp = group << 3;
02793         CVMX_SYNCWS;
02794         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH;
02795         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
02796         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.grp = group << 3;
02797         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.no_sched = no_sched;
02798     }
02799     else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02800         group &= 0x3f;
02801         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH;
02802         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.tag = tag;
02803         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.type = tag_type;
02804         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.grp = group;
02805         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.no_sched = no_sched;
02806     } else {
02807         group &= 0x0f;
02808         tag_req.s_cn38xx.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH;
02809         tag_req.s_cn38xx.tag = tag;
02810         tag_req.s_cn38xx.type = tag_type;
02811         tag_req.s_cn38xx.grp = group;
02812         tag_req.s_cn38xx.no_sched = no_sched;
02813     }
02814     ptr.u64 = 0;
02815     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02816         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02817         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02818         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG3;
02819         ptr.s_cn78xx.node =  cvmx_get_node_num();
02820         ptr.s_cn78xx.tag  = tag;
02821     } else {
02822         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02823         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02824         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG3;
02825     }
02826     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
02827 }
02828 
02829 /**
02830  * Performs a tag switch and then an immediate deschedule. This completes
02831  * immediately, so completion must not be waited for.  This function does NOT
02832  * update the wqe in DRAM to match arguments.
02833  *
02834  * This function waits for any prior tag switches to complete, so the
02835  * calling code may call this function with a pending tag switch.
02836  *
02837  * Note the following CAVEAT of the Octeon HW behavior when
02838  * re-scheduling DE-SCHEDULEd items whose (next) state is
02839  * ORDERED:
02840  *   - If there are no switches pending at the time that the
02841  *     HW executes the de-schedule, the HW will only re-schedule
02842  *     the head of the FIFO associated with the given tag. This
02843  *     means that in many respects, the HW treats this ORDERED
02844  *     tag as an ATOMIC tag. Note that in the SWTAG_DESCH
02845  *     case (to an ORDERED tag), the HW will do the switch
02846  *     before the deschedule whenever it is possible to do
02847  *     the switch immediately, so it may often look like
02848  *     this case.
02849  *   - If there is a pending switch to ORDERED at the time
02850  *     the HW executes the de-schedule, the HW will perform
02851  *     the switch at the time it re-schedules, and will be
02852  *     able to reschedule any/all of the entries with the
02853  *     same tag.
02854  * Due to this behavior, the RECOMMENDATION to software is
02855  * that they have a (next) state of ATOMIC when they
02856  * DE-SCHEDULE. If an ORDERED tag is what was really desired,
02857  * SW can choose to immediately switch to an ORDERED tag
02858  * after the work (that has an ATOMIC tag) is re-scheduled.
02859  * Note that since there are never any tag switches pending
02860  * when the HW re-schedules, this switch can be IMMEDIATE upon
02861  * the reception of the pointer during the re-schedule.
02862  *
02863  * @param tag      New tag value
02864  * @param tag_type New tag type
02865  * @param group    New group value
02866  * @param no_sched Control whether this work queue entry will be rescheduled.
02867  *                 - 1 : don't schedule this work
02868  *                 - 0 : allow this work to be scheduled.
02869  */
02870 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_desched(uint32_t tag,
02871     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint64_t group, uint64_t no_sched)
02872 {
02873     /* Need to make sure any writes to the work queue entry are complete */
02874     CVMX_SYNCWS;
02875     /* Ensure that there is not a pending tag switch, as a tag switch cannot be started
02876      * if a previous switch is still pending.  */
02877     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
02878     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_desched_nocheck(tag, tag_type, group, no_sched);
02879 }
02880 
02881 /**
02882  * Descchedules the current work queue entry.
02883  *
02884  * @param no_sched no schedule flag value to be set on the work queue entry.
02885  *     If this is set the entry will not be rescheduled.
02886  */
02887 static inline void cvmx_pow_desched(uint64_t no_sched)
02888 {
02889     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
02890     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
02891 
02892     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
02893         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
02894         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
02895         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
02896         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
02897             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
02898         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
02899             "%s called with NULL tag. Deschedule not expected from NULL state\n",
02900             __func__);
02901     }
02902     /* Need to make sure any writes to the work queue entry are complete */
02903     CVMX_SYNCWS;
02904 
02905     tag_req.u64 = 0;
02906     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02907         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH;
02908         tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.no_sched = no_sched;
02909     } else if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN68XX_WQE)) {
02910         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH;
02911         tag_req.s_cn68xx_other.no_sched = no_sched;
02912     } else {
02913         tag_req.s_cn38xx.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_DESCH;
02914         tag_req.s_cn38xx.no_sched = no_sched;
02915     }
02916     ptr.u64 = 0;
02917     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02918         ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02919         ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
02920         ptr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG3;
02921         ptr.s_cn78xx.node = cvmx_get_node_num();
02922     } else {
02923         ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
02924         ptr.s.is_io = 1;
02925         ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG3;
02926     }
02927     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
02928 }
02929 /******************************************************************************/
02930 /* OCTEON3-specific functions.                                                */
02931 /******************************************************************************/
02932 /**
02933  * This function sets the the affinity of group to the cores in 78xx.
02934  * It sets up all the cores in core_mask to accept work from the specified group.
02935  *
02936  * @param xgrp      Group to accept work from, 0 - 255.
02937  * @param core_mask Mask of all the cores which will accept work from this group
02938  * @param mask_set  Every core has set of 2 masks which can be set to accept work
02939  *     from 256 groups. At the time of get_work, cores can choose which mask_set
02940  *     to get work from. 'mask_set' values range from 0 to 3, where each of the
02941  *     two bits represents a mask set. Cores will be added to the mask set with
02942  *     corresponding bit set, and removed from the mask set with corresponding
02943  *     bit clear.
02944  * Note: cores can only accept work from SSO groups on the same node,
02945  * so the node number for the group is derived from the core number.
02946  */
02947 static inline void cvmx_sso_set_group_core_affinity(cvmx_xgrp_t xgrp,
02948         const cvmx_coremask_t * core_mask, uint8_t mask_set)
02949 {
02950     cvmx_sso_ppx_sx_grpmskx_t grp_msk;
02951     int core;
02952     int grp_index = xgrp.xgrp >> 6;
02953     int bit_pos = xgrp.xgrp % 64;
02954 
02955     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
02956         cvmx_dprintf( "ERROR: %s is not supported on this chip)\n", __FUNCTION__);
02957         return;
02958     }
02959     cvmx_coremask_for_each_core(core, core_mask) {
02960         unsigned node, ncore;
02961         uint64_t reg_addr;
02962 
02963         node = cvmx_coremask_core_to_node(core);
02964         ncore = cvmx_coremask_core_on_node(core);
02965 
02966         reg_addr = CVMX_SSO_PPX_SX_GRPMSKX(ncore, 0, grp_index);
02967         grp_msk.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, reg_addr);
02968 
02969         if(mask_set & 1)
02970             grp_msk.s.grp_msk |= (1ull << bit_pos);
02971         else
02972             grp_msk.s.grp_msk &= ~(1ull << bit_pos);
02973 
02974         cvmx_write_csr_node(node, reg_addr, grp_msk.u64);
02975 
02976         reg_addr = CVMX_SSO_PPX_SX_GRPMSKX(ncore, 1, grp_index);
02977         grp_msk.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, reg_addr);
02978 
02979         if(mask_set & 2)
02980             grp_msk.s.grp_msk |= (1ull << bit_pos);
02981         else
02982             grp_msk.s.grp_msk &= ~(1ull << bit_pos);
02983 
02984         cvmx_write_csr_node(node, reg_addr, grp_msk.u64);
02985     }
02986 }
02987 
02988 /**
02989  * This function sets the priority and group affinity arbitration for each group.
02990  *
02991  * @param node      Node number
02992  * @param xgrp      Group 0 - 255 to apply mask parameters to
02993  * @param priority  Priority of the group relative to other groups
02994  *     0x0 - highest priority
02995  *     0x7 - lowest priority
02996  * @param weight    Cross-group arbitration weight to apply to this group.
02997  *     valid values are 1-63
02998  *     h/w default is 0x3f
02999  * @param affinity  Processor affinity arbitration weight to apply to this group.
03000  *     If zero, affinity is disabled.
03001  *     valid values are 0-15
03002  *     h/w default which is 0xf.
03003  * @param modify_mask   mask of the parameters which needs to be modified.
03004  *     enum cvmx_sso_group_modify_mask
03005  *     to modify only priority -- set bit0
03006  *     to modify only weight   -- set bit1
03007  *     to modify only affinity -- set bit2
03008  */
03009 static inline void cvmx_sso_set_group_priority(int node, cvmx_xgrp_t xgrp,
03010             int priority, int weight, int affinity,
03011                enum cvmx_sso_group_modify_mask modify_mask)
03012 {
03013     cvmx_sso_grpx_pri_t grp_pri;
03014 
03015     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
03016         cvmx_dprintf(
03017             "ERROR: %s is not supported on this chip)\n",
03018             __FUNCTION__);
03019         return;
03020     }
03021     if (weight <= 0)
03022         weight = 0x3f;  /* Force HW default when out of range */
03023 
03024     grp_pri.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_SSO_GRPX_PRI(xgrp.xgrp));
03025     if(grp_pri.s.weight == 0)
03026         grp_pri.s.weight = 0x3f;
03027     if(modify_mask & CVMX_SSO_MODIFY_GROUP_PRIORITY)
03028         grp_pri.s.pri = priority;
03029     if(modify_mask & CVMX_SSO_MODIFY_GROUP_WEIGHT)
03030         grp_pri.s.weight = weight;
03031     if(modify_mask & CVMX_SSO_MODIFY_GROUP_AFFINITY)
03032         grp_pri.s.affinity = affinity;
03033     cvmx_write_csr_node(node,CVMX_SSO_GRPX_PRI(xgrp.xgrp),grp_pri.u64);
03034 }
03035 
03036 /**
03037  * Asynchronous work request.
03038  * Only works on CN78XX style SSO.
03039  *
03040  * Work is requested from the SSO unit, and should later be checked with
03041  * function cvmx_pow_work_response_async.
03042  * This function does NOT wait for previous tag switches to complete,
03043  * so the caller must ensure that there is not a pending tag switch.
03044  *
03045  * @param scr_addr Scratch memory address that response will be returned to,
03046  *     which is either a valid WQE, or a response with the invalid bit set.
03047  *     Byte address, must be 8 byte aligned.
03048  * @param xgrp  Group to receive work for (0-255).
03049  * @param wait
03050  *     1 to cause response to wait for work to become available (or timeout)
03051  *     0 to cause response to return immediately
03052  */
03053 static inline void cvmx_sso_work_request_grp_async_nocheck(int scr_addr,
03054     cvmx_xgrp_t xgrp, cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
03055 {
03056     cvmx_pow_iobdma_store_t data;
03057     unsigned int node = cvmx_get_node_num();
03058     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
03059         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
03060         cvmx_warn_if(!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE), "Not CN78XX");
03061     }
03062     /* scr_addr must be 8 byte aligned */
03063     data.u64 = 0;
03064     data.s_cn78xx.scraddr = scr_addr >> 3;
03065     data.s_cn78xx.len = 1;
03066     data.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
03067     data.s_cn78xx.grouped = 1;
03068     data.s_cn78xx.index_grp_mask = (node << 8) | xgrp.xgrp ;
03069     data.s_cn78xx.wait = wait;
03070     data.s_cn78xx.node = node;
03071 
03072     cvmx_send_single(data.u64);
03073 }
03074 
03075 /**
03076  * Synchronous work request from the node-local SSO without verifying
03077  * pending tag switch. It requests work from a specific SSO group.
03078  *
03079  * @param lgrp The local group number (within the SSO of the node of the caller)
03080  *     from which to get the work.
03081  * @param wait When set, call stalls until work becomes avaiable, or times out.
03082  *     If not set, returns immediately.
03083  *
03084  * @return Returns the WQE pointer from SSO.
03085  *     Returns NULL if no work was available.
03086  */
03087 static inline void *cvmx_sso_work_request_grp_sync_nocheck(unsigned int lgrp,
03088     cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
03089 {
03090     cvmx_pow_load_addr_t ptr;
03091     cvmx_pow_tag_load_resp_t result;
03092     unsigned int node = cvmx_get_node_num() & 3;
03093 
03094     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
03095         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
03096         cvmx_warn_if(!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE), "Not CN78XX");
03097     }
03098     ptr.u64 = 0;
03099     ptr.swork_78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
03100     ptr.swork_78xx.is_io = 1;
03101     ptr.swork_78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
03102     ptr.swork_78xx.node = node;
03103     ptr.swork_78xx.grouped = 1;
03104     ptr.swork_78xx.index = (lgrp & 0xff) | node << 8;
03105     ptr.swork_78xx.wait = wait;
03106 
03107     result.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(ptr.u64);
03108     if (result.s_work.no_work)
03109         return NULL;
03110     else
03111         return cvmx_phys_to_ptr(result.s_work.addr);
03112 }
03113 
03114 /**
03115  * Synchronous work request from the node-local SSO.
03116  * It requests work from a specific SSO group.
03117  * This function waits for any previous tag switch to complete before
03118  * requesting the new work.
03119  *
03120  * @param lgrp The node-local group number from which to get the work.
03121  * @param wait When set, call stalls until work becomes avaiable, or times out.
03122  *     If not set, returns immediately.
03123  *
03124  * @return The WQE pointer or NULL, if work is not available.
03125  */
03126 static inline void *cvmx_sso_work_request_grp_sync(unsigned int lgrp,
03127     cvmx_pow_wait_t wait)
03128 {
03129     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
03130     return cvmx_sso_work_request_grp_sync_nocheck(lgrp, wait);
03131 }
03132 
03133 /**
03134  * This function sets the group mask for a core.  The group mask bits
03135  * indicate which groups each core will accept work from.
03136  *
03137  * @param core_num  Processor core to apply mask to.
03138  * @param mask_set  7XXX has 2 sets of masks per core.
03139  *     Bit 0 represents the first mask set, bit 1 -- the second.
03140  * @param xgrp_mask Group mask array.
03141  *     Total number of groups is divided into a number of
03142  *     64-bits mask sets. Each bit in the mask, if set, enables
03143  *     the core to accept work from the corresponding group.
03144  *
03145  * NOTE: Each core can be configured to accept work in accordance to both
03146  * mask sets, with the first having higher precedence over the second,
03147  * or to accept work in accordance to just one of the two mask sets.
03148  * The 'core_num' argument represents a processor core on any node
03149  * in a coherent multi-chip system.
03150  *
03151  * If the 'mask_set' argument is 3, both mask sets are configured
03152  * with the same value (which is not typically the intention),
03153  * so keep in mind the function needs to be called twice
03154  * to set a different value into each of the mask sets,
03155  * once with 'mask_set=1' and second time with 'mask_set=2'.
03156  */
03157 static inline void cvmx_pow_set_xgrp_mask( uint64_t core_num,
03158         uint8_t mask_set, const uint64_t xgrp_mask[])
03159 {
03160     cvmx_sso_ppx_sx_grpmskx_t grp_msk;
03161     unsigned grp, node, core;
03162     uint64_t reg_addr;
03163 
03164     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
03165         cvmx_dprintf( "ERROR: %s is not supported on this chip)\n",
03166             __FUNCTION__);
03167         return;
03168     }
03169 
03170     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
03171         cvmx_warn_if(((mask_set < 1) || (mask_set > 3)), "Invalid mask set");
03172     }
03173 
03174     if ((mask_set < 1) || (mask_set > 3))
03175         mask_set = 3;
03176 
03177     node = cvmx_coremask_core_to_node(core_num);
03178     core = cvmx_coremask_core_on_node(core_num);
03179 
03180     for (grp = 0; grp < (cvmx_sso_num_xgrp() >> 6); grp++) {
03181         reg_addr = CVMX_SSO_PPX_SX_GRPMSKX(core, 0, grp),
03182         grp_msk.u64 = 0;
03183         if (mask_set & 1) {
03184             grp_msk.s.grp_msk = xgrp_mask[grp];
03185             cvmx_write_csr_node(node, reg_addr, grp_msk.u64);
03186         }
03187 
03188         reg_addr = CVMX_SSO_PPX_SX_GRPMSKX(core, 1, grp),
03189         grp_msk.u64 = 0;
03190         if (mask_set & 2) {
03191             grp_msk.s.grp_msk = xgrp_mask[grp];
03192             cvmx_write_csr_node(node, reg_addr, grp_msk.u64);
03193         }
03194     }
03195 }
03196 
03197 /**
03198  * Executes SSO SWTAG command.
03199  * This is similiar to cvmx_pow_tag_sw() function, but uses linear
03200  * (vs. integrated group-qos) group index.
03201  */
03202 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_node(cvmx_wqe_t *wqp, uint32_t tag,
03203     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, int node)
03204 {
03205     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
03206     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
03207 
03208     if (cvmx_unlikely(!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))) {
03209         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: %s is suppored on OCTEON3 only\n", __func__);
03210         return;
03211     }
03212     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03213     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
03214 
03215     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
03216         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
03217         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
03218         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
03219         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
03220             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
03221         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
03222             "%s called with NULL tag\n", __func__);
03223         cvmx_warn_if((current_tag.tag_type == tag_type) && (current_tag.tag == tag),
03224             "%s called to perform a tag switch to the same tag\n", __func__);
03225         cvmx_warn_if(tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
03226             "%s called to perform a tag switch to NULL. "
03227             "Use cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null() instead\n", __func__);
03228     }
03229     wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag = tag;
03230     wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag_type = tag_type;
03231     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03232 
03233     tag_req.u64 = 0;
03234     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG;
03235     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
03236 
03237     ptr.u64 = 0;
03238     ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
03239     ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
03240     ptr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
03241     ptr.s_cn78xx.node = node;
03242     ptr.s_cn78xx.tag  = tag;
03243     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
03244 }
03245 
03246 /**
03247  * Executes SSO SWTAG_FULL command.
03248  * This is similiar to cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full() function, but
03249  * uses linear (vs. integrated group-qos) group index.
03250  */
03251 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full_node(cvmx_wqe_t * wqp, uint32_t tag,
03252     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint8_t xgrp, int node)
03253 {
03254     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
03255     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
03256     uint16_t gxgrp;
03257 
03258     if (cvmx_unlikely(!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))) {
03259         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: %s is suppored on OCTEON3 only\n", __func__);
03260         return;
03261     }
03262     /* Ensure that there is not a pending tag switch, as a tag switch cannot be
03263      * started, if a previous switch is still pending. */
03264     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03265     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
03266 
03267     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
03268         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
03269         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
03270         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
03271         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
03272             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
03273         cvmx_warn_if((current_tag.tag_type == tag_type) && (current_tag.tag == tag),
03274             "%s called to perform a tag switch to the same tag\n", __func__);
03275         cvmx_warn_if(tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
03276             "%s called to perform a tag switch to NULL. "
03277             "Use cvmx_pow_tag_sw_null() instead\n", __func__);
03278         if ((wqp != cvmx_phys_to_ptr(0x80)) && cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp())
03279             cvmx_warn_if(wqp != cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp(),
03280                 "%s passed WQE(%p) doesn't match the address in the POW(%p)\n",
03281                 __func__, wqp, cvmx_pow_get_current_wqp());
03282     }
03283     gxgrp = node;
03284     gxgrp = gxgrp << 8 | xgrp;
03285     wqp->word1.cn78xx.grp = gxgrp;
03286     wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag = tag;
03287     wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag_type = tag_type;
03288     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03289 
03290     tag_req.u64 = 0;
03291     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_FULL;
03292     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
03293     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.grp = gxgrp;
03294     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.wqp = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
03295 
03296     ptr.u64 = 0;
03297     ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
03298     ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
03299     ptr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG;
03300     ptr.s_cn78xx.node = node;
03301     ptr.s_cn78xx.tag  = tag;
03302     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
03303 }
03304 
03305 /**
03306  * Submits work to an SSO group on any OCI node.
03307  * This function updates the work queue entry in DRAM to match
03308  * the arguments given.
03309  * Note that the tag provided is for the work queue entry submitted,
03310  * and is unrelated to the tag that the core currently holds.
03311  *
03312  * @param wqp pointer to work queue entry to submit.
03313  * This entry is updated to match the other parameters
03314  * @param tag tag value to be assigned to work queue entry
03315  * @param tag_type type of tag
03316  * @param xgrp native CN78XX group in the range 0..255
03317  * @param node The OCI node number for the target group
03318  *
03319  * When this function is called on a model prior to CN78XX, which does
03320  * not support OCI nodes, the 'node' argument is ignored, and the 'xgrp'
03321  * parameter is converted into 'qos' (the lower 3 bits) and 'grp' (the higher
03322  * 5 bits), following the backward-compatibility scheme of translating
03323  * between new and old style group numbers.
03324  */
03325 static inline void cvmx_pow_work_submit_node(cvmx_wqe_t * wqp, uint32_t tag,
03326     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint8_t xgrp, uint8_t node)
03327 {
03328     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
03329     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
03330     uint16_t group;
03331 
03332     if (cvmx_unlikely(!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))) {
03333         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: %s is suppored on OCTEON3 only\n", __func__);
03334         return;
03335     }
03336     group = node;
03337     group = group << 8 | xgrp;
03338     wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag = tag;
03339     wqp->word1.cn78xx.tag_type = tag_type;
03340     wqp->word1.cn78xx.grp = group;
03341     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03342 
03343     tag_req.u64 = 0;
03344     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_ADDWQ;
03345     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
03346     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.wqp = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
03347     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.grp = group;
03348 
03349     ptr.u64 = 0;
03350     ptr.s_cn78xx.did = 0x66; //CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG6;
03351     ptr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
03352     ptr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
03353     ptr.s_cn78xx.node = node;
03354     ptr.s_cn78xx.tag = tag;
03355 
03356     /* SYNC write to memory before the work submit.  This is necessary
03357      ** as POW may read values from DRAM at this time */
03358     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03359     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
03360 }
03361 
03362 /**
03363  * Executes the SSO SWTAG_DESCHED operation.
03364  * This is similar to the cvmx_pow_tag_sw_desched() function, but
03365  * uses linear (vs. unified group-qos) group index.
03366  */
03367 static inline void cvmx_pow_tag_sw_desched_node(cvmx_wqe_t *wqe, uint32_t tag,
03368     cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tag_type, uint8_t xgrp, uint64_t no_sched, uint8_t node)
03369 {
03370     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr ptr;
03371     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t tag_req;
03372     uint16_t group;
03373 
03374     if (cvmx_unlikely(!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))) {
03375         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: %s is suppored on OCTEON3 only\n", __func__);
03376         return;
03377     }
03378     /* Need to make sure any writes to the work queue entry are complete */
03379     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03380     /* Ensure that there is not a pending tag switch, as a tag switch cannot
03381      * be started if a previous switch is still pending.  */
03382     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
03383 
03384     if (CVMX_ENABLE_POW_CHECKS) {
03385         cvmx_pow_tag_info_t current_tag;
03386         __cvmx_pow_warn_if_pending_switch(__func__);
03387         current_tag = cvmx_pow_get_current_tag();
03388         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL_NULL,
03389             "%s called with NULL_NULL tag\n", __func__);
03390         cvmx_warn_if(current_tag.tag_type == CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_NULL,
03391             "%s called with NULL tag. Deschedule not allowed from NULL state\n", __func__);
03392         cvmx_warn_if((current_tag.tag_type != CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC) &&
03393             (tag_type != CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC),
03394             "%s called where neither the before or after tag is ATOMIC\n", __func__);
03395     }
03396     group = node;
03397     group = group << 8 | xgrp;
03398     wqe->word1.cn78xx.tag = tag;
03399     wqe->word1.cn78xx.tag_type = tag_type;
03400     wqe->word1.cn78xx.grp = group;
03401     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03402 
03403     tag_req.u64 = 0;
03404     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_SWTAG_DESCH;
03405     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.type = tag_type;
03406     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.grp = group;
03407     tag_req.s_cn78xx_other.no_sched = no_sched;
03408 
03409     ptr.u64 = 0;
03410     ptr.s.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
03411     ptr.s.is_io = 1;
03412     ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG3;
03413     ptr.s_cn78xx.node =  node;
03414     ptr.s_cn78xx.tag  = tag;
03415     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, tag_req.u64);
03416 }
03417 
03418 /* Executes the UPD_WQP_GRP SSO operation.
03419  *
03420  * @param wqp  Pointer to the new work queue entry to switch to.
03421  * @param xgrp SSO group in the range 0..255
03422  *
03423  * NOTE: The operation can be performed only on the local node.
03424  */
03425 static inline void cvmx_sso_update_wqp_group(cvmx_wqe_t *wqp, uint8_t xgrp)
03426 {
03427     union cvmx_pow_tag_req_addr addr;
03428     cvmx_pow_tag_req_t data;
03429     int node = cvmx_get_node_num();
03430     int group = node <<  8 | xgrp;
03431 
03432     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
03433         cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: %s is not supported on this chip)\n", __FUNCTION__);
03434         return;
03435     }
03436     wqp->word1.cn78xx.grp = group;
03437     CVMX_SYNCWS;
03438 
03439     data.u64 = 0;
03440     data.s_cn78xx_other.op = CVMX_POW_TAG_OP_UPDATE_WQP_GRP;
03441     data.s_cn78xx_other.grp = group;
03442     data.s_cn78xx_other.wqp = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(wqp);
03443 
03444     addr.u64 = 0;
03445     addr.s_cn78xx.mem_region = CVMX_IO_SEG;
03446     addr.s_cn78xx.is_io = 1;
03447     addr.s_cn78xx.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1;
03448     addr.s_cn78xx.node = node;
03449     cvmx_write_io(addr.u64, data.u64);
03450 }
03451 
03452 /******************************************************************************/
03453 /* Define usage of bits within the 32 bit tag values.                         */
03454 /******************************************************************************/
03455 /*
03456  * Number of bits of the tag used by software.  The SW bits
03457  * are always a contiguous block of the high starting at bit 31.
03458  * The hardware bits are always the low bits.  By default, the top 8 bits
03459  * of the tag are reserved for software, and the low 24 are set by the IPD unit.
03460  */
03461 #define CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS    (8)
03462 #define CVMX_TAG_SW_SHIFT   (32 - CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS)
03463 
03464 /* Below is the list of values for the top 8 bits of the tag. */
03465 /* Tag values with top byte of this value are reserved for internal executive uses */
03466 #define CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS_INTERNAL  0x1
03467 
03468 /* The executive divides the remaining 24 bits as follows:
03469 * the upper 8 bits (bits 23 - 16 of the tag) define a subgroup
03470 * the lower 16 bits (bits 15 - 0 of the tag) define are the value with
03471 * the subgroup. Note that this section describes the format of tags generated
03472 * by software - refer to the hardware documentation for a description of the tags
03473 * values generated by the packet input hardware.
03474 * Subgroups are defined here */
03475 #define CVMX_TAG_SUBGROUP_MASK  0xFFFF /* Mask for the value portion of the tag */
03476 #define CVMX_TAG_SUBGROUP_SHIFT 16
03477 #define CVMX_TAG_SUBGROUP_PKO  0x1
03478 
03479 /* End of executive tag subgroup definitions */
03480 
03481 /* The remaining values software bit values 0x2 - 0xff are available
03482  * for application use */
03483 
03484 /**
03485  * This function creates a 32 bit tag value from the two values provided.
03486  *
03487  * @param sw_bits The upper bits (number depends on configuration) are set
03488  *     to this value.  The remainder of bits are set by the hw_bits parameter.
03489  * @param hw_bits The lower bits (number depends on configuration) are set
03490  *     to this value.  The remainder of bits are set by the sw_bits parameter.
03491  *
03492  * @return 32 bit value of the combined hw and sw bits.
03493  */
03494 static inline uint32_t cvmx_pow_tag_compose(uint64_t sw_bits, uint64_t hw_bits)
03495 {
03496     return ((((sw_bits & cvmx_build_mask(CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS)) << CVMX_TAG_SW_SHIFT) |
03497         (hw_bits & cvmx_build_mask(32 - CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS))));
03498 }
03499 
03500 /**
03501  * Extracts the bits allocated for software use from the tag
03502  *
03503  * @param tag    32 bit tag value
03504  *
03505  * @return N bit software tag value, where N is configurable with
03506  *     the CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS define
03507  */
03508 static inline uint32_t cvmx_pow_tag_get_sw_bits(uint64_t tag)
03509 {
03510     return ((tag >> (32 - CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS)) & cvmx_build_mask(CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS));
03511 }
03512 
03513 /**
03514  *
03515  * Extracts the bits allocated for hardware use from the tag
03516  *
03517  * @param tag    32 bit tag value
03518  *
03519  * @return (32 - N) bit software tag value, where N is configurable with
03520  *     the CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS define
03521  */
03522 static inline uint32_t cvmx_pow_tag_get_hw_bits(uint64_t tag)
03523 {
03524     return (tag & cvmx_build_mask(32 - CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS));
03525 }
03526 
03527 static inline uint64_t cvmx_sso3_get_wqe_count(int node)
03528 {
03529     cvmx_sso_grpx_aq_cnt_t aq_cnt;
03530     unsigned grp = 0;
03531     uint64_t cnt = 0;
03532 
03533     for( grp = 0; grp < cvmx_sso_num_xgrp(); grp++) {
03534         aq_cnt.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_SSO_GRPX_AQ_CNT(grp));
03535         cnt += aq_cnt.s.aq_cnt;
03536     }
03537     return cnt;
03538 }
03539 
03540 static inline uint64_t cvmx_sso_get_total_wqe_count(void)
03541 {
03542     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE))
03543     {
03544         int node = cvmx_get_node_num();
03545         return cvmx_sso3_get_wqe_count(node);
03546     }
03547     else if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX))
03548     {
03549         cvmx_sso_iq_com_cnt_t sso_iq_com_cnt;
03550         sso_iq_com_cnt.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_SSO_IQ_COM_CNT);
03551         return (sso_iq_com_cnt.s.iq_cnt);
03552     }
03553     else
03554     {
03555         cvmx_pow_iq_com_cnt_t pow_iq_com_cnt;
03556         pow_iq_com_cnt.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_POW_IQ_COM_CNT);
03557         return(pow_iq_com_cnt.s.iq_cnt);
03558     }
03559 }

03563  * buffer. It is recommended that you pass a buffer of at least
03564  * 128KB. The format of the capture may change based on SDK
03565  * version and Octeon chip.
03566  *
03567  * @param buffer Buffer to store capture into
03568  * @param buffer_size The size of the supplied buffer
03569  *
03570  * @return Zero on sucess, negative on failure
03571  */
03572 extern int cvmx_pow_capture(void *buffer, int buffer_size);

03580 extern void cvmx_pow_display(void *buffer, int buffer_size);

03590 /**
03591  * This will allocate count number of SSO groups on the specified node to the
03592  * calling application. These groups will be for exclusive use of the application
03593  * until they are freed.
03594  * @param node The numa node for the allocation.
03595  * @param base_group Pointer to the initial group, -1 to allocate anywhere.
03596  * @param count  The number of consecutive groups to allocate.
03597  * @return 0 on success and -1 on failure.
03598  */
03599 int cvmx_sso_reserve_group_range(int node, int *base_group, int count);
03600 #define cvmx_sso_allocate_group_range cvmx_sso_reserve_group_range
03601 int cvmx_sso_reserve_group(int node);
03602 #define cvmx_sso_allocate_group cvmx_sso_reserve_group
03603 int cvmx_sso_release_group_range(int node, int base_group, int count);
03604 int cvmx_sso_release_group(int node, int group);
